data.event: The first permanent settlers (about 30 families) moved into the area in 1864 at the direction of leaders of The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints.
In 1866 troubles with Indians who used the area as their hunting ground (the Black Hawk War (Utah)) forced the white settlers to retreat to the Manti area.
They returned to Salina in 1871, organized a militia, and constructed a fort and buildings for a school and a church.
The Sevier River was tapped in 1874, and by 1908 the area west of the settlement was being fully cultivated.

event.title: 1908 the area west of the settlement was being fully cultivated

data.event: The Sevier River was tapped in 1874, and by 1908 the area west of the settlement was being fully cultivated.
